  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Technical Assistant Consultant",
  "description": "Palladium is a global leader in the design, development and delivery of Positive Impact - the intentional creation of enduring social and economic value. We work with foundations, investors, governments, corporations, communities and civil society to formulate strategies and implement solutions that generate lasting social, environmental and financial benefits.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Technical Technical Assistant Consultant&nbsp;- Nigeria

Job ID:&nbsp;req24832
Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria

About the Project


	The WISH Dividend Policy and Systems programme supports an African-led, inclusive accelerated Demographic Transition (DT) and advance sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) through Technical Assistance (TA) activities in 7 countries in Sub Saharan Africa.
	WISH Dividend P&amp;S is a component of the wider WISH 2 Dividend, a significant investment from the British Government in Demographic Transition and SRHR to unlock the potential, agency, and freedom of women and girls to achieve gender equality and is central to delivering the UK&rsquo;s priorities on Empowering Women and Girls set out in the International Development Strategy.
	Through WISH P&amp;S, Palladium will improve national capacity to catalyse an accelerated inclusive demographic transition and an improved enabling policy and health systems environment for SRHR.


Objectives of the Assignment
&nbsp;The Technical Assistance aims to:&nbsp;


	Conduct a root cause analysis of ownership gaps in last-mile FP commodity delivery&nbsp;
	Map institutional roles and accountability frameworks.&nbsp;
	Identify&nbsp;financial and human resource constraints.&nbsp;
	Develop actionable recommendations and a short-term roadmap to strengthen ownership and sustainability.&nbsp;


Scope of Work
The consultant will undertake the following tasks:&nbsp;


	Conduct a rapid diagnostic of current last-mile delivery mechanisms&nbsp;in&nbsp;Jigawa&nbsp;State.&nbsp;
	Map stakeholders and analyse their roles, responsibilities, and accountability structures.&nbsp;
	Identify bottlenecks and institutional gaps contributing to poor ownership.&nbsp;
	Facilitate consultations and workshops with key actors to validate findings.&nbsp;
	Develop recommendations and a short-term roadmap for strengthening ownership.&nbsp;


Minimum Requirements


	Advanced&nbsp;degree (at least Masters) in Social Sciences,&nbsp;Development Studies, Medicine, Public Health, Supply Chain Management/Logistics&nbsp;or any other related fields.&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Experience:&nbsp;5&ndash;7+ years of experience in health logistics, pharmaceutical supply management, or reproductive health program management, with a specific focus on last-mile operations.
	Demonstrable experience in conducting Root Cause Analysis or other&nbsp;systemic&nbsp;evaluations within the public health sector&nbsp;
	Strong background in institutional strengthening, governance, and accountability frameworks.
	Experience working with government agencies, private sector, and community stakeholders.
	Excellent facilitation, communication, and report-writing skills.&nbsp;

Technical Assistant Consultant Job at Palladium Group




        
    

        
        Palladium is a global leader in the design, development and delivery of Positive Impact - the intentional creation of enduring social and economic value. We work with foundations, investors, governments, corporations, communities and civil society to formulate strategies and implement solutions that generate lasting social, environmental and financial benefits.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Technical Technical Assistant Consultant - Nigeria

Job ID: req24832
Job Location: Nigeria

About the Project
     

            
    




	The WISH Dividend Policy and Systems programme supports an African-led, inclusive accelerated Demographic Transition (DT) and advance sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) through Technical Assistance (TA) activities in 7 countries in Sub Saharan Africa.
	WISH Dividend P&S is a component of the wider WISH 2 Dividend, a significant investment from the British Government in Demographic Transition and SRHR to unlock the potential, agency, and freedom of women and girls to achieve gender equality and is central to delivering the UK’s priorities on Empowering Women and Girls set out in the International Development Strategy.
	Through WISH P&S, Palladium will improve national capacity to catalyse an accelerated inclusive demographic transition and an improved enabling policy and health systems environment for SRHR.


Objectives of the Assignment
 The Technical Assistance aims to: 


	Conduct a root cause analysis of ownership gaps in last-mile FP commodity delivery 
	Map institutional roles and accountability frameworks. 
	Identify financial and human resource constraints. 
	Develop actionable recommendations and a short-term roadmap to strengthen ownership and sustainability. 


Scope of Work
The consultant will undertake the following tasks: 


	Conduct a rapid diagnostic of current last-mile delivery mechanisms in Jigawa State. 
	Map stakeholders and analyse their roles, responsibilities, and accountability structures. 
	Identify bottlenecks and institutional gaps contributing to poor ownership. 
	Facilitate consultations and workshops with key actors to validate findings. 
	Develop recommendations and a short-term roadmap for strengthening ownership. 


Minimum Requirements


	Advanced degree (at least Masters) in Social Sciences, Development Studies, Medicine, Public Health, Supply Chain Management/Logistics or any other related fields.  
	Experience: 5–7+ years of experience in health logistics, pharmaceutical supply management, or reproductive health program management, with a specific focus on last-mile operations.
	Demonstrable experience in conducting Root Cause Analysis or other systemic evaluations within the public health sector 
	Strong background in institutional strengthening, governance, and accountability frameworks.
	Experience working with government agencies, private sector, and community stakeholders.
	Excellent facilitation, communication, and report-writing skills. 
    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quantity Surveyor",
  "description": "Kingrock International Nigeria Limited, founded in 2012, is a leading player in Nigeria&rsquo;s mining industry. Headquartered in Abuja, we specialize in the exploration, development, and processing of mineral resources across the country. With a strong commitment to sustainable practices, safety, and technological innovation, we have built a reputation for excellence and reliability in the sector. Our dynamic team and forward-thinking leadership continue to drive growth and expansion in both local and international markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quantity Surveyor
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment Type: Part-time
&zwnj;Work Field&zwnj;: Engineering / Civil / Telecommunications / Mechanical / Electrical / Petrochemical Industries
&zwnj;Work Experience&zwnj;: 3 - 30 years

&zwnj;Job Responsibilities&zwnj;


	Mineral Rights Application and Approval&zwnj;
	Organize the application, registration, renewal, and amendment of exploration and mining rights to ensure compliance with regulations. Track approval progress.
	Mineral Rights Renewal and Maintenance&zwnj;
	Regularly inspect the status of mineral rights to ensure legal compliance.
	Policy Research and Compliance Management&zwnj;
	Monitor mining policies and regulations, formulate compliance strategies, and mitigate legal risks. Participate in the resolution of mineral rights disputes to protect company interests.
	Field Exploration
	Possess field exploration experience in mining.


&zwnj;Job Requirements&zwnj;


	Educational Requirement&zwnj;: Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Geology
	Have more than 3 years of experience in mining and exploration, familiar with the business of the Nigerian Mining Bureau and Ministry of Mines.
	Must hold the qualification from the Council of Mining and Earth Scientists (COMEG) of Nigeria.
	Loyal to the company, able to work stably and long-term, honest and trustworthy, with good professional ethics and no record of fraudulent behavior.
	Quick-thinking, fluent language, standard English accent.
	Experience in international companies is preferred, knowledge of Chinese is preferred.
	Able to work independently and proactively, with good work habits, able to plan, execute, and report work on time, forming a work loop.
	Strong coordination, communication, and leadership skills, able to listen, and excellent interpersonal and social skills.


&zwnj;Salary&zwnj;
Negotiable.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates shouldsend their CV to:kaibonigeria@kaibogroup.comusing the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquires contact via: Application Phone&zwnj;: 09168313223; &zwnj;WhatsApp&zwnj;: 09168313223.",

Quantity Surveyor Job at Kingrock International Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Kingrock International Nigeria Limited, founded in 2012, is a leading player in Nigeria’s mining industry. Headquartered in Abuja, we specialize in the exploration, development, and processing of mineral resources across the country. With a strong commitment to sustainable practices, safety, and technological innovation, we have built a reputation for excellence and reliability in the sector. Our dynamic team and forward-thinking leadership continue to drive growth and expansion in both local and international markets.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quantity Surveyor
Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Part-time
‌Work Field‌: Engineering / Civil / Telecommunications / Mechanical / Electrical / Petrochemical Industries
‌Work Experience‌: 3 - 30 years

‌Job Responsibilities‌


	Mineral Rights Application and Approval‌
	Organize the application, registration, renewal, and amendment of exploration and mining rights to ensure compliance with regulations. Track approval progress.
	Mineral Rights Renewal and Maintenance‌
	Regularly inspect the status of mineral rights to ensure legal compliance.
	Policy Research and Compliance Management‌
	Monitor mining policies and regulations, formulate compliance strategies, and mitigate legal risks. Participate in the resolution of mineral rights disputes to protect company interests.
	Field Exploration
	Possess field exploration experience in mining.


‌Job Requirements‌


	Educational Requirement‌: Bachelor's Degree in Geology
	Have more than 3 years of experience in mining and exploration, familiar with the business of the Nigerian Mining Bureau and Ministry of Mines.
	Must hold the qualification from the Council of Mining and Earth Scientists (COMEG) of Nigeria.
	Loyal to the company, able to work stably and long-term, honest and trustworthy, with good professional ethics and no record of fraudulent behavior.
	Quick-thinking, fluent language, standard English accent.
	Experience in international companies is preferred, knowledge of Chinese is preferred.
	Able to work independently and proactively, with good work habits, able to plan, execute, and report work on time, forming a work loop.
	Strong coordination, communication, and leadership skills, able to listen, and excellent interpersonal and social skills.


‌Salary‌
Negotiable.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates shouldsend their CV to:kaibonigeria@kaibogroup.comusing the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquires contact via: Application Phone‌: 09168313223; ‌WhatsApp‌: 09168313223.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Resident Engineer (Civil / Highway)",
  "description": "Jamub Group is a conglomerate of different companies duly registered in line with relevant laws of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, the attribute of which makes us a non-cyclical organisation. Established to deliver solutions in the various areas of our business interests, our delivery model spans Business to Business (B2B), Business to Government (B2G) and Business to Consumer (B2C) in the economic value chain with a range of products and services which cut across the industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Resident Engineer (Civil / Highway)

Job Location:&nbsp;Gboko, Benue

Job Summary


	The Resident Engineer will be responsible for providing on-site technical leadership and oversight for highway construction projects.
	The role involves taking key engineering decisions, interpreting construction drawings, supervising site activities, conducting measurements, and ensuring works are executed in accordance with approved designs, specifications, safety standards, and timelines.
	The Resident Engineer will also double as the Work Zone Traffic Control (WZTC) Supervisor for the project.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide day-to-day on-site engineering supervision of highway construction works.
	Interpret and implement approved construction drawings, specifications, and method statements.
	Take key technical decisions required for smooth project execution.
	Ensure construction works comply with approved designs, contract documents, and engineering standards.
	Review and validate site measurements, quantities, and progress reports.
	Provide direct supervision of foremen, site engineers, technicians, and other site workforce.
	Coordinate construction activities to ensure efficient workflow and timely completion.
	Monitor workmanship and material usage to ensure quality and cost control.
	Identify construction challenges and propose practical engineering solutions.
	Serve as the Work Zone Traffic Control (WZTC) Supervisor on the project.
	Ensure proper implementation of traffic management plans during construction.
	Coordinate traffic control personnel and ensure compliance with safety regulations.
	Minimize disruption to road users while ensuring safety of workers and the public.
	Enforce site safety policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.
	Ensure compliance with environmental, health, and safety (EHS) standards.
	Participate in site safety meetings and incident investigations when required.
	Prepare and submit daily, weekly, and monthly site progress reports.
	Liaise with the Project Manager, consultants, and relevant stakeholders on-site matters.
	Support inspections, audits, and handover processes as required.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Civil Engineering or related discipline.
	Minimum of 12&ndash;15 years of post-qualification experience in highway construction and engineering.
	COREN Registered Civil/Highway Engineer (Mandatory).
	Proven experience in supervising major road/highway construction projects.
	Strong understanding of construction drawings, specifications, and site measurements.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;jobs@jamubgroup.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Resident Engineer (Civil / Highway) Job at Jamub Group




        
    

        
        Jamub Group is a conglomerate of different companies duly registered in line with relevant laws of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, the attribute of which makes us a non-cyclical organisation. Established to deliver solutions in the various areas of our business interests, our delivery model spans Business to Business (B2B), Business to Government (B2G) and Business to Consumer (B2C) in the economic value chain with a range of products and services which cut across the industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Resident Engineer (Civil / Highway)

Job Location: Gboko, Benue

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Resident Engineer will be responsible for providing on-site technical leadership and oversight for highway construction projects.
	The role involves taking key engineering decisions, interpreting construction drawings, supervising site activities, conducting measurements, and ensuring works are executed in accordance with approved designs, specifications, safety standards, and timelines.
	The Resident Engineer will also double as the Work Zone Traffic Control (WZTC) Supervisor for the project.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide day-to-day on-site engineering supervision of highway construction works.
	Interpret and implement approved construction drawings, specifications, and method statements.
	Take key technical decisions required for smooth project execution.
	Ensure construction works comply with approved designs, contract documents, and engineering standards.
	Review and validate site measurements, quantities, and progress reports.
	Provide direct supervision of foremen, site engineers, technicians, and other site workforce.
	Coordinate construction activities to ensure efficient workflow and timely completion.
	Monitor workmanship and material usage to ensure quality and cost control.
	Identify construction challenges and propose practical engineering solutions.
	Serve as the Work Zone Traffic Control (WZTC) Supervisor on the project.
	Ensure proper implementation of traffic management plans during construction.
	Coordinate traffic control personnel and ensure compliance with safety regulations.
	Minimize disruption to road users while ensuring safety of workers and the public.
	Enforce site safety policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.
	Ensure compliance with environmental, health, and safety (EHS) standards.
	Participate in site safety meetings and incident investigations when required.
	Prepare and submit daily, weekly, and monthly site progress reports.
	Liaise with the Project Manager, consultants, and relevant stakeholders on-site matters.
	Support inspections, audits, and handover processes as required.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering or related discipline.
	Minimum of 12–15 years of post-qualification experience in highway construction and engineering.
	COREN Registered Civil/Highway Engineer (Mandatory).
	Proven experience in supervising major road/highway construction projects.
	Strong understanding of construction drawings, specifications, and site measurements.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs and Cover Letter to: jobs@jamubgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Account Officer",
  "description": "Rainbow College is a leading Nigerian Secondary School that uses a blended curriculum of Nigerian and Cambridge curricula to deliver a global approach to teaching and nurturing in an ideal environment. Rainbow College operates under Rainbow Educational Services Limited (RESL), a top-flight education management company in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Handle campus accounts payable and receivable
	Maintain an up-to-date billing system
	Generate and send out invoices as due
	Follow up on, collect, and allocate payments in Xero ERP promptly
	Carry out billing, collection, and reporting activities according to specific deadlines
	Perform account reconciliations of all debtors
	Monitor customer account details for non-payments, delayed payments, and other irregularities
	Research and resolve invoice &amp; receipt discrepancies
	Maintain campus imprest and expenses payments with prompt posting in Xero ERP
	Other duties as assigned.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	B.Sc or HND in Accounting or Finance,
	1- 3 years of accounting &amp; finance experience.
	ACA/ACCA/MBA is an added advantage.
	Highest level of integrity, excellence &amp; creativity
	Data/finacial analysis skills
	Excellent multi-tasking abilities
	Knowledge and understanding of Nigerian Taxation Laws
	Knowledge of Xero accounting ERP and the ability to use the entire MS Office suite will be an added advantage.
	Ability to communicate effectively with co-workers, vendors, and clients
",

  "validThrough": "2026-03-01",

Account Officer Job at Rainbow College




        
    

        
        Rainbow College is a leading Nigerian Secondary School that uses a blended curriculum of Nigerian and Cambridge curricula to deliver a global approach to teaching and nurturing in an ideal environment. Rainbow College operates under Rainbow Educational Services Limited (RESL), a top-flight education management company in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Handle campus accounts payable and receivable
	Maintain an up-to-date billing system
	Generate and send out invoices as due
	Follow up on, collect, and allocate payments in Xero ERP promptly
	Carry out billing, collection, and reporting activities according to specific deadlines
	Perform account reconciliations of all debtors
	Monitor customer account details for non-payments, delayed payments, and other irregularities
	Research and resolve invoice & receipt discrepancies
	Maintain campus imprest and expenses payments with prompt posting in Xero ERP
	Other duties as assigned.


Qualifications & Skills


	B.Sc or HND in Accounting or Finance,
	1- 3 years of accounting & finance experience.
	ACA/ACCA/MBA is an added advantage.
	Highest level of integrity, excellence & creativity
	Data/finacial analysis skills
	Excellent multi-tasking abilities
	Knowledge and understanding of Nigerian Taxation Laws
	Knowledge of Xero accounting ERP and the ability to use the entire MS Office suite will be an added advantage.
	Ability to communicate effectively with co-workers, vendors, and clients
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Major Account Manager/Key Account Manager",
  "description": "Pivotage Consulting is an HR consulting firm located in Lagos state, Nigeria, committed to helping organizations build strong, efficient, and compliant workforces. We partner with businesses across industries to deliver practical HR solutions tailored to their unique needs and growth goals.

Our services include: recruitment, outsourcing, background checks, training and development, manpower audit and HR advisory. We combine industry expertise, data-driven processes, and deep local market knowledge to support organizations in attracting, managing, and retaining top talent.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Major Account Manager

2.) Key Account Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: ICT / Technology Sales

Requirements


	Major Account Manager - 3-5 years of experience
	Key Account Manager - 2-3 years of experience.
	Strong negotiation and presentation skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Ability to manage multiple accounts and deliver results.
	Demonstrated success in achieving sales targets.


Salary


	Major Account Manager: N500,000 / Month.
	Key Account Manager: N350,000 / Month.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;Olubunmi@pivotageconsulting.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Major Account Manager &ndash; ICT or Key Account Manager - ICT&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.

Note:&nbsp;If you are passionate about ICT solutions and thrive in a fast-paced sales environment, we&rsquo;d love to hear from you.",

  "validThrough": "2026-03-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Pivotage Consulting"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"

Major Account Manager/Key Account Manager Job at Pivotage Consulting




        
    

        
        Pivotage Consulting is an HR consulting firm located in Lagos state, Nigeria, committed to helping organizations build strong, efficient, and compliant workforces. We partner with businesses across industries to deliver practical HR solutions tailored to their unique needs and growth goals.

Our services include: recruitment, outsourcing, background checks, training and development, manpower audit and HR advisory. We combine industry expertise, data-driven processes, and deep local market knowledge to support organizations in attracting, managing, and retaining top talent.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Major Account Manager

2.) Key Account Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: ICT / Technology Sales

Requirements


	Major Account Manager - 3-5 years of experience
	Key Account Manager - 2-3 years of experience.
	Strong negotiation and presentation skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Ability to manage multiple accounts and deliver results.
	Demonstrated success in achieving sales targets.


Salary


	Major Account Manager: N500,000 / Month.
	Key Account Manager: N350,000 / Month.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Olubunmi@pivotageconsulting.com using “Major Account Manager – ICT or Key Account Manager - ICT” as the subject of the mail.

Note: If you are passionate about ICT solutions and thrive in a fast-paced sales environment, we’d love to hear from you.    

    

        Click here to Apply
